Class HangmanModel

java.lang.Object
HangmanModel
public class HangmanModel
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for storing all of the information about the game and handling all of the game mechanics that don't directly affect the GUI components. Some of its important functions include generating new words and keeping track of the number of lives remaining, the incorrect guesses made so far, and all of the guesses made so far.
Since:
11/10/21
Author:
Tucker Dickson

    This ArrayList of Strings holds all of the guesses by the user
    private java.lang.String word
    This private String represents the word being used in a game
    private java.lang.String[] wordList
    This private array of Strins holds 213 possible words to choose from.

  • Field Details

    • wordList

      private java.lang.String[] wordList
      This private array of Strins holds 213 possible words to choose from. The words in this list were taken from https://www.hangmanwords.com/words

    • word

      private java.lang.String word
      This private String represents the word being used in a game

    • incorrectGuesses

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> incorrectGuesses
      This ArrayList of Strings holds all of the characters incorrectly guessed by the user

    • totalGuesses

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> totalGuesses
      This ArrayList of Strings holds all of the guesses by the user

    • numLives

      private int numLives
      This private int represents the number of "lives" the user has remaining

    • getWord

      java.lang.String getWord()
      This method acts as the getter for word. It simply returns word.
      Returns:
      This function returns the word private instance variable.

    • getNumLives

      int getNumLives()
      This method acts as the get for numLives. It simply returns numLives.
      Returns:
      This method returns an int representing numLives.

    • getIncorrectGuesses

      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getIncorrectGuesses()
      This method acts as the getter for incorrectGuesses. It simply returns incorrectGuesses.
      Returns:
      This method returns an ArrayList of Strings referring to incorrectGuesses.

    • getTotalGuesses

      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTotalGuesses()
      This method acts as the getter for totalGuesses. It simply returns totalGuesses.
      Returns:
      This method returns an ArrayList of Strings referring to totalGuesses.

    • setNumLives

      void setNumLives​(int numLives)
      This method acts as the setter for numLives. It takes in an int and uses it to initialize numLives.
      Parameters:
      numLives - This int is used to initialize numLives.

    • addIncorrectGuess

      void addIncorrectGuess​(java.lang.String guess)
      This method takes in a String and adds it to incorrectGuesses. It does this by using the List.add() method.
      Parameters:
      guess - This String will be added to incorrectGuesses.

    • addGuess

      void addGuess​(java.lang.String guess)
      This method takes in a String and adds it to totalGuesses. It does this by using the List.add() method.
      Parameters:
      guess - This String will be added to totalGuesses.

    • gameOver

      boolean gameOver()
      This method is responsible for determining whether the game is over. If numLives is less than or equal to zero, this method returns false, otherwise it returns true.
      Returns:
      The method returns a boolean value indicating whether the game is over.

    • didWin

      boolean didWin()
      This method is responsible for determining whether the player won the game or not. It does this by evaluating numLives and then comparing the letters in totalGuesses with the letters in word. If numLives is greater than zero and all of the letters in word have been guessed, this method returns true.
      Returns:
      This method returns a boolean value indicating whether the user has won the game.

    • clear

      void clear()
      This method is responsible for re-initializing all of the member variables to their start-game state. This method is called when the a new HangmanModel object is constructed (at the start of the first game), and then again each subsequent game.
